newsitem.title: USA: US T-bond augments losses, yield at 3-week high.
newsitem.headline: US T-bond augments losses, yield at 3-week high.

text.p: The price of the benchmark U.S. Treasury bond completed a full-point decline -- its yield reaching a three-week high -- in early afternoon trade.
U.S. Treasury prices had been under pressure ever since the government reported stronger-than-expected orders for durable goods in July.
"It's a thin environment," explained Kevin Flanagan, first vice president and money market economist at Dean Witter Reynolds.

"The durable goods report was another shot across the bow that perhaps not all the economic numbers we get will be favorable for the market," Reynolds said. "They might make it appear that the degree of deceleration in the economy might be less than what the market was counting on."
The 6-3/4 percent 30-year bond was down a point to 97-27/32 around 1220 EDT/1620 GMT, its yield at 6.92 percent, a three-week high.
Durable goods orders rose 1.6 pct in July, the government reported early in the trading session.
Without defense-related orders, the number was up 3.5 percent in July after falling 1.2 percent in June.
